I think this is the usual error logged when there is an attempt to 
connect to the HTTPS server with a normal HTTP connect � and so may not 
be related to your CXML issue.

Any problems building the CXML will typically be reported in the 
browser, as part of the Job Log on the Job page.

What did the browser show after trying 'build' with your CXML?

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/29/10 2:13 PM, burakkk wrote:
>
>
> Hello,
> When i tried to build spring configuration file(cxml), i got this error
> message:
>
> javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: Remote host closed connection
> during handshake
> at
> com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:808)
> at
> com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.performInitialHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1120)
> at
> com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1147)
> at
> com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1131)
> at
> org.mortbay.jetty.security.SslSocketConnector$SslConnection.run(SslSocketConnector.java:631)
> at
> org.mortbay.thread.QueuedThreadPool$PoolThread.run(QueuedThreadPool.java:522)
> Caused by: java.io.EOFException: SSL peer shut down incorrectly
> at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.InputRecord.read(InputRecord.java:333)
> at
> com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:789)
> ... 5 more
>
> How can i fix it?
> thanks
> regards...
